intro: Osmorhiza bolanderi, commonly known as Bolander's sweetroot, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of California and southern Oregon. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its aromatic, often hollow stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, white to yellowish flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. Its root system is fibrous and has been historically used by indigenous peoples for its medicinal properties. Osmorhiza bolanderi thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal scrub and woodland habitats.
